By the way, this places doesn't use the best quality, organic products. Their stuff is Trader Joe's. Look at the boxes behind the display. I did. It made me wonder how they charge as much as they do...
author: Peggy B.

description:
I trusted a 7x7 magazine shoutout and stellar Yelp reviews, and made a point to rise unusually early (at 8:30am) and headed to Cassava with the bf and another friend for weekend breakfast/brunch.

We weren't disappointed! First off, the decor is very cozy yet modern, minimalistic and simply darling. The space is a bit small so you'll find yourself wiggling about if you take seats inside the cafe; that's probably why more people find themselves at their outdoor seating on the sidewalk, even if it's in the chilly, breezy Richmond fog. Tip* - if you prefer the warmth, come early. 

Everyone there were so friendly. The lady at the counter (I assume is the owner) found out we were first-timers and briskly walked us through the menu - coffees and tea, japanese breakfast, brunch food, pastries. 

We ended up getting honey lattes, a danish, a curry puff, herbal iced tea and chatted until they started serving brunch. Then we ordered the Meatballs in Curry and Rice, Shrimp & Avocado Sliders, and Japanese Breakfast to try. 

The Meatballs in Curry and Rice is awesome! Delicious and flavorful meatballs in tantalizing curry sauce, pipping hot with rice. The Shrimp and Avocado Sliders were equally tasty. I'm a sucker for avocados, and the flavor blended amazingly with the succulent large shrimps tomato, lettuce, red onion salsa, harrisa sauce on challa buns. YUM.

Now, the Japanese Breakfast was "interesting" - Koshihikari rice, ichiban dashi miso soup, sous vide "onsen tamago" poached egg, Meyer lemon kosho natto, wakame salad, simmered mushroom and tofu. I was very intrigued with the dishes initially, and when the tray arrived, the presentation was impressive. However, maybe I'm just not used to the textures and flavors of Japanese breakfasts, but I found the cold rice, slimy natto combo a bit hard to swallow. The miso soup was good, and the onsen tamago poached egg was smooth, light, and 'harmonious' to the palate. It was definitely worth trying once. I just didn't find it to be my liking, as I did the meatball and slider dishes.

The overall experience was pretty awesome though, so I'll definitely go back! I want my own Meatball dish next time. All mine!
author: Jing D.

description:
I stopped by before Outside Lands- I rarely have an opportunity to venture in the Richmond district and chose to eat here for breakfast.  Cassava is a pretty small place- there's probably only about three tables inside and two tables outside.. but it's small in all the right ways- it felt cozy and was a homely shelter from the usual SF fog and breeze.

I had the Japanese breakfast along with a coffee (they're currently brewing Ritual Beans coffee, and brew it pretty damn well).  The Japanese breakfast consisted of "Koshihikari plum rice, ichiban dashi miso soup, sous vide "onsen tamago" poached egg, Meyer lemon kosho natto, wakame salad, and simmered hijik."  It definitely wasn't your typical breakfast, but was delicious nonetheless.  The poached egg was delicious, and they also added this tiny flower freshly picked from the garden right outside of their cafe!

Kris and Yuka are extremely cute and welcoming.  I decided to sit outside because I wanted the fresh air, and she asked me twice if I was sure that I wanted to sit in the cold weather and if I wanted a seat inside instead.

I definitely will be back to try to their curry puffs, and if I was a Richmond local I would definitely be a regular for my daily coffee fix!
author: Tiffany K.

description: A really cute and friendly cafe.  We received fast and efficient service on a very busy Sunday. The servings were on the small size but our two orders were very good. I want to try more from the menu.
author: Linda K.

description: A lot of potential but needs a bit of tweaking on speed of service and taste.  Staff was very nice but piecemeal delivery of items. Coffee served warm with no cream or sugar and several attempts to request items. Menu is interesting but doesn't quite mesh on flavors or preparation.  Very cute place and could be awesome. I would try again in a few months.
author: Ros M.

description: We enjoyed the Valentines tasting menu dinner at Cassava very much. I forgot to get flowers for my wife but she totally forgave me after I took her here. Every course was delicious and the owners and staff made us feel welcome and taken care of. On their regular menu I am also a big fan of the Japanese breakfast set. It's been quite impressive watching Cassava pull off the transition from being a tiny coffee shop when they first opened into the full restaurant that they are today!
author: Jonathan G.

description: My wife and came here for the first time and we're very pleasantly surprised. I will recommend to my friends and will be back again. Scallops were excellent and carrot soup superb. Thanks for wonderful service too.
author: Jay H.

description:
Love this little place now opened in the outer richmond.  need little gems like this.  Enjoyed the coffee and the brunch menu.  tiny cafe, maybe 4 tables.  

had the ham, egg and kale puff pasty, really good pastry and filling.  on the small portion, with a side salad.
the poached eggs were yummy, the toast and quince perserve  were like crack, i need to get more of that preserve.

the dessert were good as well.  had the peanut butter cornflakes cookies, not too sweet, should buy a dozen next time
author: ray l.

description: Love this place. So cute... so warm and inviting. Their food is all very fresh, healthy, and delicious.  I love the "Mr & Mrs Croque" Sandwich!  I also love their fresh squeezed juices.  Perfect place for a weekend brunch.
author: Suzanna F.

description:
Finally, a foodie place in the outer Richmond! It had to happen eventually. Saw some press about it last week and was excited to see it finally open. 

Cassava lived up to my high expectations. The food is fantastic: creative, delicious, beautifully presented, and reasonably priced. I get the impression that it will be a rotating menu, and what I had today was excellent, especially the cauliflower soup with garlic crouton and green apple garnish.

The cafe is very cute, too - i love the mini terrariums in the window - and they can seat 6 people inside the tiny space, with more chairs out front. 

Overall: high end cafe food. By far the best thing our neighborhood has going - and I love our neighborhood. I hope they put a parklet out front like devils teeth has so I can still get a seat after the crowds descend on it!
author: andrea s.

description: Sweet little cafe with yummy elixir type drinks and fresh food ... Spices Honey Latte is delish!  Loved family time in this tiny place.
author: 'Michelle A.

description:
Cute store front; kinda Noe Valley hipster chic.  Stopped by late Saturday morning for brunch and found the place to be surprisingly busy.  There are only 3 tables inside which seats only 7 people total and a table outside.  BF had the chicken pressed panini ($7) and I had the poached egg with toast and quince jam ($5).  Both dishes came with a small side of lettuce with thinly sliced cucumbers and radishes; lightly dressed.  They gave out 2 complimentary peanut butter shortbread cookies with corn flake bits for yelp checking in. They were intereresting; BF liked them more than I did.

The food was tasty and reasonably priced. I enjoyed the foccacia of the panini and my pieces of toast the best.  The poached egg was slightly undercooked.  Water comes in tiny pastic dixie cups, so if you're a thirsty drinker like me, you might have to make multiple trips to the water carafe.

Service was friendly, if a bit green. Another couple who came in and ordered after us seemingly got their food prior to us, so the wait for our food was kind of long.  Workers were running the cash register, taking orders, waiting tables, and busing the plates; so everyone looked a little frazzled. Overall though, a nice addition to the Outer Richmond that I would stop by again if I'm in the area and hungry.  Cash only for now.
author: Mercutio k.

description: My friend and I had a late breakfast and it was absolutelt delicious! The service was friendly and uncomplicated. The place pretty and you feel instantly welcome. A gem in this neighborhood. Highly recommend!
author: Cornelia I.

description: Our first time at this place was fantastic! Food and drinks were delicious, service was decent. The place has a great vibe and plenty of seating if outdoor seating is open. After reading the reviews, we made a reservation and even though this was a holiday, we were able to get a table within an hour. Will definitely come back again!
author: Greg S.

description:
Two words: COLD FOOD

All of our food was cold. Everything, I mean everything was cold including the soup that came with the Japanese Breakfast.

We had the Japanese Breakfast and the Hash bowl. Both come served with SV eggs. Not a fan of their execution because the egg white and the yolk had almost identical textures. If you are going to SV, then it should be an improvement over traditional cooking technique. Blech.

Beyond the fact that the food was cold the food was bland, bland bland. I have never had chorizo with almost zero flavor. The only thing in that dish that you could really taste was the overwhelming chemical tasting white truffle oil.

Wanted to love this place because it's close but doubt we will be going back.

We ended up going to Louis for food afterward
author: Jamie b.

description: Nice remodel--good coffee, and intentional food choices for people who care.  No one seems to know what to do when you walk in, because it is a counter order place, but looks like you might get table service.  I have seen this each time I have been there.  So...the ambience/following hasn't really developed yet it seems, the block/neighborhood is undergoing a bit of a revival and I wish we saw more places with seasonal fresh food options and with clean updated exterior/interiors.  It is a good alternative breakfast or lunch option to the others around it.  I haven't tried it for dinner yet--would like to see more choices on the menu, but am hoping it makes it and smooths out the kinks.
author: Rita G.

description:
I work a few blocks from this cafe. For a few weeks I was eating vegan and it was really hard to find any decent lunch options until I stopped in one day and saw that they had vegan cauliflower cassoulet. Super-nice midday fine dining comfort food moment.  I sat outside first and the staff were nice enough to take the effort to tell me when a seat inside opened up. Their Friday night pop up dinners look fun and I think they do a vegan one once a month or so.

I wanted to bring a few friends here to try the japanese breakfast last month but the space was too tiny for the five of us and the weather was too foggy to eat outside. I did see one dude enjoying his meal so maybe the key here is just to come early and chow down solo.  So we went to get dumplings down the street, and came back for dessert and coffee afterwards. We lingered for awhile, and felt totally welcome, which was nice, since we all don't get to meet up like that too often and we were looking for a low key place to hang out for my birthday.
author: Miz J.

description: Don't really understand the hype about this place.  Came here this morning with my boyfriend and the customer service was great but that was about it.  I ordered the Breakfast Sandwich which seemed as if though the croissant was slopped with a bunch of oil and then severely over toasted.  Quality of the black forest ham seemed whatever, nothing that warrants a $7 sandwich.  I'd rather go to Devil's Tooth and have their breakfast sandwich for $5 and be satisfied.  My boyfriend ordered the Japanese Breakfast which came into segmented parts (didn't seem like this from the menu) and needless to say we didn't finish our meals.  Also, I noticed the "American Cheese" on the tuna melt is pretty much Kraft singles...gross.
author: Lidia L.

description: Cassava's coffee and meals are always fresh and on point. Service comes with a smile. It's always worth the wait. Thank you please
author: Allen W.

description:
Came here for a post work out meal.

Short Rib Sliders - these were fall off the bone tender, if there were any bones in the sliders, which there weren't. The pairing of caramelized onions, gruyere, and bitter greens are a good standard, and you can expect tons of slightly sweet flavors with a hint of bitterness to really tingle the taste buds. The sweet roll/brioche bun brings it together and is seriously perfect, as it absorbed all the juiciness of the meat, keeping all the flavors together instead of spilling onto the plate. The side salad that comes with the two sliders was very refreshing, especially for a post work out meal. 

Meat balls with curry sauce. Apparently there is tofu mixed in with the meat in the meatballs, which is damn smart. Tofu absorbs a lot of flavor, and aside from absorbing the flavors of the beef, the flavor of the curry was further infused into the meatball because of the tofu. The curry sauce was very different... almost sweet like a marinara, but still had the subtle spices of a mild curry. 

Mocha - oh man, I really like their mochas here. If I had to rank my favorite mochas, this is a triple tie between Philz (SF) and Pannakin (San Deigo). This drink was brewed so perfectly, and had just the right amount of chocolate. You could appreciate the roasty taste of the espresso, as well as the smoothness of the chocolate without having it muted by sugar. 

The friendliest staff you'll meet. Yuka  and Kris are awesome! There are pop up dinners at this spot, but seating is limited. 

I should have got the peanut butter cookie. It looked good. I'll be coming back again soon haha.
author: Marc T.

description:
This post is dedicated not only to Cassava B + C, but also to the girl in line before me who did not order the last mushroom and kale quiche, leaving it to be all mine!

Visited again recently and grabbed myself a free curry puff and peanut butter cookie (yes, courtesy of Scoutmob) along with a $4 mushroom and kale quiche...

- Curry Puff: Seriously deliciously buttery and flakey pastry.  I gobbled this up so quickly, I can't even tell you about its insides.  Should have ordered more. 
- Peanut Butter Cookie: Honestly, not my favorite PBC ever, but good, and I appreciated its cornflake crunch.
- Mushroom and Kale Quiche: I think I am in love, and I normally don't even like quiche!  Amazing flavors with quite possibly the best crust I've ever had.  Man, I'm craving another right now!!

So thank you, Cassava C + B, for bringing your tasty treats to the neighborhood.  I cannot wait to return for more snacks, brunch, tapas (?!?), and for your pop up restaurant.

Oh, and of course - girl in line before me?  Thanks again for that last quiche.
author: Mel T.

description:
I became addicted to curry puffs one summer in Singapore and since then I've never had one in SF that I've loved as much but after using a scoutmob deal to get a free peanut butter cookie + curry puff = I'm addicted. Again.

My boyfriend and I will now take 2 mile runs through the park that just haaaappen to end up at Cassava. I call it the "earn your curry puff" run. Helped me finish strong at an Olympic triathlon this weekend so it's a WIN! Also, when it's gray and dark out there in the richmond and I'm on my way to work in Sausalito there's nothing like a warm bourbon vanilla honey latte to warm ya right up. Also went there this morning after having to go to the doctor, I guess I really like rewarding myself with their great food and comfy surroundings.

It's a bit pricier than, say, making my coffee at work but it's really the REWARD this place offers and the great teamwork of the husband + wife team that make it so rad. And adorable. Every time we're heading home from our "earn your curry puff runs" my boyfriend and I talk about opening our own place like this. 

Can't wait to try one of their dinners, keep up the good work!
author: Arianna P.

description: Finally this cute cafe opened this morning! When I walked in, I was immediately greeted by warm welcome. An atmosphere is very bright and welcoming. Super clean and neat. They serve Ritual coffee and it was very good! I had a mushroom quiche & peanut butter cookies. They were excellent! Salad looks great, too. They use fresh ingredients and  bring out best of them with their skill. Can't wait to go back to try soup & sandwiches. I am so happy now we have a cafe we can go for their food & coffee in this side of town.
author: Samantha S.

description: We originally wanted to go to the Ramen Festival in Japantown but it was so pack we decided to come here. My boyfriend and I were celebrating our anniversary and had a late brunch. I made reservations over Yelp just in case they were packed and when we arrived, there were a few tables opened but we wanted to sit outside since we had our dog. As soon as a patron was done with their check, they cleaned up the table and seated us within 2 minutes. I ordered the same thing as I did last time, the 72 hour braised ribs and my boyfriend ordered the curry meatballs. They were both very good, we also ordered the crab salad which wasn't bad but felt the blue cheese overwhelmed the dish. We also got macarons to go, in all a good visit.
author: Linda L.

description: Nice Saturday brunch, had the meatball curry with fried egg.  Delicious comfort food!
author: Greg N.

description:
It was a four before... now it's a five.  They've expanded their menu, their vegetarian lunch option (actually it's vegan) is unbelievably tasty (I have seldom had a tastier sandwich) and the two owners are LITERALLY (to quote Chris Traeger of Parks and Rec) the cutest people/couple on the planet.  

They are SO sweet, the food is SO yummy and they are SO hardworking.  They couldn't be more than 30 years old and these two work their BUTT OFF.  Honestly, I have so much respect for them.

Yes, the wait is long (they currently have no competition within three miles) and they can get pretty backed up, but they are totally worth it.  My advice is go on the early side, whether it's breakfast, brunch or lunch (I haven't tried their small bites evenings they just started but I'm sure it's busy too!)
author: Bianca G.

description: My husband & I enjoyed the Pop Up Dinner last night. Outstanding! Cassava is going to be the next HOT spot!
author: Emily D.

description:
The place is pretty tiny, but always has a small crowd of people inside when I grab my caffeine fix in the morning!  I like it a lot... like a homey cute vibe going on.

Their quiche is really good, but pretty expensive for breakfast food.  Melted cheese on top really finishes it off nicely.  

The best thing ever at this place is the soy latte.  Holy cow they put some kind of spice (probably nutmeg?) in it.  I don't know how else to describe it besides HEAVENLY.  

Kind of sad that they charge extra for soy because a lot of hipster places these days don't charge extra since soy is kind of a given.
author: Anna T.

description: Leaves you wanting more. Food and drinks are moderately priced but lack substance.  Brunch was too basic and we felt we could cook the same food at home.  If you bring a hearty appetite, order two items. For example, the waffle is the size of the galaxy cell phone.  The remodel increased the size but attention to details were overlooked. Sorry cassava...your staff members are really nice but I think the food needs a makeover now.
author: Laurie R.

description: Love this little gem in outer Richmond.  I came here for breakfast right before the rush. The menu for brunch is a little usual for my taste but I got the waffle with thick cut bacon and scrambled eggs.  It was amazing!  I have no idea what they did to those eggs but they were the best scrambled eggs I've ever had. The Waddell was also delicious and not too sweet. The restaurant it's self is really cute and the service was great too. I'm definitely coming back here for lunch someday :). Four stars!
author: P N.

description: Just had a wonderful dinner at Cassava. It's like havijg a meal at a friends house. They take care of you from the moment you walk in.  The food is beautiful. In particular the chicken is fabulous, slow cooked, it retains all the flavour and moisture. The best chicken I've had in the city.  Thank you Cassava for such a treat.
author: Alex A.

description:
I'm so happy this place moved in the hood! I stumbled across by accident and tried their curry puff - wow, seriously buttery deliciousness. 

I can't wait to come back and try their hot food!
author: Leanne S.

description: Cute cute place! Popped in to check it out and the mushroom quiche looked amazing. Took it home and was not disappointed! Creamy and flavorful with a buttery and flakey crust. It's making my mouth water just thinking about it. Definitely will be back!!
author: Cassie B.

description: Love this place. They were the first higher end foodie cafe to open on Balboa, and we weren't sure they would make it, but from expanding their store to adding the outdoor seating, they've grown to one of the more popular restaurants in the neighborhood. I love their breakfast sandwich, scrambled eggs, and turkey sandwich. We've also been to one of their pop up dinners, and it was a lovely experience with amazing food with a variety of influences. The only thing I don't love is their coffee - they serve Ritual, which I typically like, but for some reason it always tastes bitter here. Overall, I recommend highly!
author: sarah s.

description: Used scoutmob for the deal delicious curry pastry, the cookie was tiny and dry but their southern fruit tea was really good!
author: Kathryn B.

description: Great brunch. Tried the Japanese breakfast and the waffle. The Japanese breakfast was good: the flavors were subtle, not too salty or loud. It was extremely healthy. The waffle comes with eggs, and they replaced bacon with avocado. It tasted great. Bright dining room and nice attention to details with decorations, mugs, chopsticks, flowers, etc. Friendly staff. The mocha lattes were excellent. Call ahead if you can, it gets crowded.
author: Chris H.

description: Mr. and Mrs and the mushroom quiche was the ticket! Soooo good! Kinda pricey but you get what u pay for.
author: T L.

description: Their quiche is awesome. Wish it was a bit bigger for the price. Don't like that they don't serve decaf coffee and their coffee is extremely strong! Grilled cheese is a hit as well!
author: Tessa M.

description: I love the Japanese breakfast here!  Their miso soup is so good, they make it from scratch and not just some kind of store bought paste.  They ferment their own soybeans for over a year to make the miso.  That's dedication and effort to good food.  I also love the brunch here, currently I'm in love with their house smoked trout, so tender and yummy!  Their dinner menu changes with the seasons and I tried the scallop with parsnip purée risotto, it was amazing!  I live in the neighborhood and so happy there's a neighborhood eats like this.
author: Emie L.

description:
I've been here on three different occasions and they've  featured three different vegetables each time: squash, portobello mushroom, and brussel sprouts. (i know, i know, you probably cringed at the latter)  I'm guessing their menu varies daily.
Surprisingly, they've managed to incorporate these featured items into each dish perfectly. My favorites so far have been the squash soup, squash quiche, and the veggie panini with grilled portobello mushroom. All the dishes were so flavorful! Portions are perfect for individuals to enjoy.
The quiche is a MUST TRY, it's served with a small silver spoon and it's toasted to perfection, not too thick but still decadent and creamy. I also noticed that a lot of people dropped in to pick up coffee and pastries to go, so I'm guessing their special drinks must be more than decent. 
The staff is super friendly and the service is quick. There's about 8 seats in the shop for customers to sit and dine, so I highly suggest to dress warm if you're going to decide to dine outdoors, especially when it's a typical cold and foggy SF kind of day.
author: Ada C.

description: Amazing brunch. I tried the meatballs and the Liege waffle plate and they were both delicious. Their scrambled eggs are incredibly soft and the Liege waffle tastes way better than most belgian waffles I've had.
author: Amin S.

description: First of all, I like this cute neighborhood place. Large window view and real seasonal and hand crafted  food here. We ordered liege waffle with maple ricotta ($14) and the japanese breakfast ($13). Both really good. I also ordered home made yogurt with granola it was full with seasonal fruits, honey as well.  I took off two stars here only because there is one staff here does not have good attitude to customers. No smile and no welcome feelings when we sitted  even no thank you when we walk out from the restaurant. I am not sure if she is the owner here or manager here. I will come back for the food and hoping to see better service next time. I believe that no matter how good the food is in the restaurant, a server or staff who approach to customers will put the first impression for people who are first timers. Therefore, I will give it another try and see if I can get a not too demanding face from staff her next time.
author: Jenny C.

description: Stop by on a Thursday night looking for a quick bite. Read the menu on the door and decided to go in to try their Quinoa and Citrus Salad. There was only one other table being occupied so I was able to sit wherever I liked. I sat, ordered, and food was brought out immediately. I was so happy with this salad. One of the best I ever had. And it was filling! I saw that they also served coffee, so I ordered their Honey Latte. A latte with honey (of course), cloves, citrus, nutmeg and some other spices I can't recall, but it was probably the tastiest lattes I ever had. The salad and the latte makes me wants to go back just to relive these moments. Also, the waitress was very friendly and patient when I asked her how much quinoa was in the salad so that I can add it to my food calculations. Overall experience, excellent!
author: Aimey T.

description: I walk  by this place once inwhile, and finally got to eat there today! Let me just say that the meatball curry was mouth watering good, and I was sad when I finished my meal. I am coming back for sure!
author: Mars F.

description:
My default lunch spot.

Cassava blends the right amount of adventurous food (e.g., the curry meatballs), high quality, good service, and reasonable price.

The food at Cassava is very interesting. It's seemingly normal, but there are a lot of nice, subtle flavors and combinations that take a tuna sandwich and make it special.

The coffee is most excellent and the desserts are very tasty.

The staff is friendly and they know their customers (and their customers' dogs and kids).

You can't go wrong with Cassava.
author: David P.

description: I only had an appetizer dish to try because I was going to dinner after a meeting.  I had the white asparagus with poached egg.  It was good.  I would need to try other items on the menu to give it a more better review.
author: JJAMZ C.

description: Yuka, Chris and Yuki are so attentive and kind. This cafe is by far my favorite in the city and I'm even more thrilled there is such a gem in my neighborhood. Everything about Cassava is great quality and taste, that's to these guys. From the food, service and decor, I simply adore. The pastries are all yummy, the rose macarons rock, I love their morning breakfast hash (breakfast menu changes), and I love that they have green tea lattes. They also do pop up dinners that are so well crafted it's a must try. I've bright so many off mt friends here every opportunity I get. I was going to say that the downside back then was that the size of the cafe was small and had limited seating, but now that is not an issue, as they have expanded their cafe. The joys!
author: Alice L.

description: I was so inspired by the food in this restaurant that I sent a an email recommendation to 150 people.  Every bite of every dish was a succulent decadence designed to delight, and the service was so considerate.   I can NOT wait to go back!
author: Dr. Sam R.

description: Good vibes with decent food & coffee. A nice addition to the Outer Richmond. The menus are located in a really inconvenient place, which is a hassle whether you're looking for a menu or the person standing in the way of someone looking for a menu. It's great to have somewhere in the Outer Richmond that isn't cash only, and it's super clean which is great.
author: Lynae C.

description: Cute spot, emblematic of the quaint, serious changes to the food and culture of the Outer Sunset & Outer Richmond.  The coffee is among some of the best I have had in my life, but it will take a few more visits before my disbelief wears off.  Wonderful cappucino - now I want one, writing about this.  The pastries, treats, edibles, and the like all were amazing. I passed on eating any, but you can rely on other reviews... I imagine they tasted as good as they looked.  I will say - there was a bit of "art" on the wall that annoyed me.  It was a reworking of an Oscar Wild quote on consistency or routine, done in the style of Jenny Holzer.  It was the single most derivative piece of art I have scene in years, and it stood out like a sore thumb. To me. Not sure why. It didn't seem to be bothering anyone else. Welcome to my mind.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
Finally! What a refreshing change. Its about time Balboa St. had a place like Cassava. An intimate breakfast/lunch spot with a daily changing menu of sandwiches, salads, soups, home made pastries and such. Cassava features high standards, high quality ingredients, a creative menu, a super accommodating staff, and a tastefully adorned interior. I'm so tired of walking down this stretch of Balboa and finding the usual run-down, dumpy looking restaurants offering the same boring food. Now there's an alternative. Cassava is bringing classy back.

But on to the important part: the eats. So far everything I've tried has been excellent. The Poached Chicken Panini was tremendous, especially loved the combination of carmelized fennel and harrisa sauce. The Turkey Grilled Cheese was fantastic, mouthwatering. The Curry Puffs are a delicious little snack. Can't wait to try the rest of the menu. 

Customer service is important to me, and they do a great job of it. The staff, as I mentioned, is really friendly and happy to serve you. The interior, though small, is really charming and tasteful. Unlike most of the restaurants/shops on Balboa street, Cassava actually cares about how their place looks. That's nice to see, and hopefully will inspire other businesses in the area to do the same.
author: Ralphie K.

description: Hooray for a delicious, creative place in the outer Richmond - great for coffee and snacks, and they also have pop-up dinners that i am looking forward to trying. They're expanding so there should be more room inside soon!
author: G And M L.

description: I think this place is probably the closest you're going to get to a hipster-y spot in this part of town. I ordered the Randwich! which was pretty delicious, but at $12 I really expected the side salad to be more than about 1/2 cup of shredded iceberg lettuce with one, yes one, piece each of spinach and arugula. C'mon - seriously? I can list a handful of other restaurants that will serve the same exact sandwich with a little bit of a heartier side. Service was ok, although it took about 25 minutes for my sandwich and glass of Sangria (no fruit in it - wtf?) to come out. I can tell the vibe that they're trying to set, but it just doesn't work in this space, in this neighborhood. Since I live somewhat nearby I might bring my mom or something, but this is not the place to brunch with friends, or really take any kind of group larger than maybe 2 or 3 people. Final verdict: it's ok, but not cool/delicious enough to keep my business in the neighborhood.
author: Ashley H.

description: Cozy, charming little cafe in the Richmond District. I ordered the Green Tea Matcha Latte and purchased 1 pistachio and 1 chocolate macaron. Soon after checking in on Yelp, I received a coupon for 10% off my next purchase. Can't wait to try the other baked goods and beverages.
author: Janelle D.

description: When it's time to take my shepherd to ocean beach or order food while waiting in the usual long lines at Purple Kow across the street, Cassava is definitely the place. They make the BEST tuna melt I have ever had in my life (and I have had many!) Their customer service is unmet. I always order togo and one time, my tuna melt came without bread and my BF's curry meatballs came without rice. Thank you for thinking of him and cutting out the carbs but we can spare a few considering how much we work out!! I called back since my BF already set up his fishing pole and my dog was swimming in the waves - the manager sincerely apologized and offered me a gift card for next time. When I went to redeem it, she also gave me some delicious macaroons. Can I say customer service focused? MOST DEF!
author: Eileen W.

description: I've been wanting to try this neighborhood restaurant that I didn't realize had been there for 3 years.  Every time I drive by it's crowded.  I love the ambiance of the restaurant - wood table with cute fresh florals at each table.  Love the mason jar water glasses!  I decided to celebrate my mom's birthday here, we had a table of 6.  The menu is simple, yet classic and suits all palates.  We shared the ribs, duck mousse terrine, and ribs.  All of these starters were super delicious - I was impressed.  All the staff is super nice, they gave us extra slices of toast as well as a rib for each of us.  So so nice!   The ladies had the scallops farro "risotto" - the scallops were made perfectly and I would highly recommend this dish.  The others ordered the porchetta and hubs ordered the fowl.  Everything was super good and it really blew my mind.  They also have an awesome happy hour - the house wine was $20 for a bottle.  The bill total was $200 including tip - great prices!  Thank you for the great service!
author: Meredith K.

description: The only thing that saves this place is the good coffee and nice ambience, food is pathetic here.
author: Kris H.

description: Had brunch here, ordered the Mr. and Mrs. Croque sandwich and it was hands down the BEST breakfast sandwich I've ever had. Love this place, fantastic service and everyone if friendly
author: Andrew W.

description: Their macaroons are awesome. I've never eaten macaroons before but they make me happy (the matcha green tea and the yuki one) when I have one. Their coffee isn't bad. The fruit jars have variety. Worth $5? Hrm, well, if I'm willing to pay $5 for bubble tea across the street then I guess I should be willing to pay $5 for something that is actually good for me. Very friendly service. Appreciate how cute the place is. I hope Cassava continues to do well.
author: Vicki T.

description: Outstanding brunch.  The menu is really creative and the food is cooked to perfection.  I had their cold brew coffee which was fantastic.  I also ate the breakfast croissant which had ham and arugula on it.  Sooo good!
author: Mike H.

description: Visited again this evening. Still great and warmer inside! I person in our group was celebrating his birthday and the staff were wonderful. Thank you.
author: Sarah A.

description: I can't tell you how much I love Cassava. This cafe that serves "coffee and refined bites" is absolutely adorable. Everything that I have ordered at Cassava has been ridiculously delicious. The mushroom and kale quiche is by far the best I have had anywhere. It's the kind of quiche that will convert a non-quiche lover (like myself). The "perfect" boiled egg is aptly names and though simple, is quite satisfying. Their homemade quince jam is tasty especially when spread on a buttery croissant with a hot mug of coffee to sip on. I was lucky enough to go to one of their first appetizer nights early on. I was vegan at the time and the owners were so sweet and accommodating. They made us a special appetizer dish on the fly that was not only visually appealing but also super yummy. The owners are a cute, dynamic duo and are really friendly. All in all: love this place!
author: Angelina G.

description: A relatively small menu but oh so cool. The salads are interesting and very fresh. They smoke their own trout and make they own ricotta cheese. Hence their smoke trout appetizer is very tasty. The freshly roasted chicken is tender and juicy. There is nothing I don't like about the food. The notice level us a bit high so pick a table further away from the kitchen and you will be fine.
author: Ellen D C.

description: The lattes are right on. Now for the brunch: get ready to wait and deal with a crowd. My friend and I got lucky and got a table inside at their little bar. The sandwich I had was good and I think my friend liked her bento box thing. I think the food is a bit on the pricey side, but I like what they're going for. Also pleased to see their health score posted on here! They take credit cards.
author: Yolanda Y.

description:
the only spot of sunshine this morning out there in the richmond was cassava.

the bestie and i really wanted to try cassava's brunch goodies a few weeks back, but to our dismay, they were closed for renovation. so what do we do when they re-open? grab a couple of other friends and immediately go back.

must try:
-meatball curry (add a poached egg. YUMZOOOOO.)

yummy:
-shrimp and avocado sliders (bread was tasty and shrimp seasoned perfectly)
-corn and clam chowder (lighter than most clam chowders, which i really liked)

for more of the adventurous type:
-japanese brunch (the fermented beans are an experience in themselves)
-apple, pear, carrot, and celery juice (not my thing. i'm guessing it's an acquired taste)

friends also had the hash, which i didn't try, but they all LOVED it.

will return for sure! (=
author: Mike N.

description:
I love this place!
Love to see a new business open and do well based on their consistency in quality product, spot on flavors, cool atmosphere, cool owners that you can really tell care about this place being a reflection of them, geez, even prices are so reasonable!... But really, what is more important than the food?? It's so good here. Their menu is simple & focused, and they really get how to play with flavor.
Oh, and great coffee too!
Kudos Cassava, and thanks!
author: Maria D.

description: What a cute place to pop into for a delicious cup of coffee,  munch on a pastry or enjoy a cup of their carrot soup.  Unlike most places in SF, this place is so clean.  I love this place and will definitely return:)
author: M T.

description: We went for the tasting dinner.  The experience was really marvelous.  A bright, well-lit room.  The owners were very friendly.  The pace was leisurely and the food was very tasty and varied.  This is a true neighborhood gem.
author: Kayvaan G.

description:
I was eating GOOD tasty Japanese breakfast with my friend eating Good American Breakfast in the same table together!  How cool it is!
I wonder how many places you can find like that in Bay area.
The staff was very nice and sweet. Good customer service.
Price reasonable.
I will go back after their construction done.
Missing you!
Shrimp Avocado Sliders are awesome!
author: N M.

description:
I heard about this neighborhood opening through the Ocean Beach Bulletin FB post. I never went to the bread bakery that was there before. My son goes to school up the block we decided to go for an after-school snack meal. I tried the quiche (they had made 25, and was down to 3) with salad. It was by far the most delicious quiche I have ever tasted. The melted cheese (it comes warm) on top the spinach, mushrooms (plus whatever delicious ingredients) within the tasty crust was so worth the reasonable price. Plus, the owners (Kris and wife) were friendly (they even let my son take a picture with them behind the counter) and personable. Welcome to the Richmond district!

In sum, 4-5 star trained chefs with reasonable prices. Portions are a little small, but overall, a great neighborhood gem. We also got a brownie and chocolate chip cookie to go-- again, not disappointed.
author: Joy E.

description: Based on other fellow yelpers raving about their peanut butter cornflake cookies, i decided to check out cassava bakery to try it out. The cookie was small and it should've been less than the $1 it costs. I didn't like it at all!! To me, it lacked flavor and was very crumbly. The girl at the register asked me if i heard about the cookie, because it was free a few months ago from some promotion? I told her no. If it's not free now, why would you mention that it used to be?
author: Mertani G.

description: It's good food and good for light meal. If you are hungry, you may need to order two entrée or go somewhere else. The Japanese breakfast is okay. The curry meatball is good. The porch egg was very good. Overall is pretty good for snack / light meal.
author: D. H.

description:
We eat out alot and we are not uncritical diners.   The first time we tried Cassava, shortly after they opened, we were really impressed.  Last night we went to Cassava again.  

Both times the food was very well prepared and creative and  the menu seems to change with what is fresh. The restaurant seems to use very local and organic vegetables and meats.  They had vegetarian options, fish options and such creative starters and salads.  The service staff seems highly vested in the restaurant and in personal but certainly not intrusive service. The prices are extremely moderate.   

Last night we split a quinoa salad with some other grains, arugula and citrus fruits.  The dressing was light and natural, organic citrus.  We followed that with grilled brussel sprouts in a very tasty dressing with an assortment of spinach type greens.  It also had a very unusual vegetable my lady friend identified.  I had never eaten the vegetable before, it was slightly pickled - delicious.  

Our main course was beautifully grilled lamb with an assortment of vegetables and small potatoes perfectly cooked.  This is such a special little restaurant. It is new. I hope it gets the patronage the owners, chefs and service staff deserve.  They all get top marks from me and my friend.   There was another main course I really would have liked to try with parsnips and kimchi.  We will be back to Cassava soon.
author: Phil P.

description: Reasonably priced, especially with the Yelp discount. If you can find a spot to sit here (because it always seems to be bustling), it's great. I like how simple and clean the decor is and how friendly the staff is. Plus the coffee and food are delicious and taste fresh. This is a real neighborhood gem. Plus the upside to having a slightly pricier menu is that you don't have to deal with the swarms of high schoolers at lunch. If you ever try to grab lunch in this neighborhood on a school day, you know exactly what I'm talking about. This place is like a safe haven. Filled with good eats and coffee to boot!
author: Patrick L.

description: I've been coming to Cassava since their beginning. The very beginning. I was thrilled when they opened as the neighborhood needed a better food option. I like the food but find the female owner to be a bit of an Ice Queen. Maybe she just has off days, like everyone, but it gets old as we're loyal customers who bring all of our out of town friends and family here. The male owner is always pleasant. We'll keep on coming because there aren't many decent alternatives. Glad their business has thrived.
author: R R.

description: Nom, nom, nom....I think that's what you young folks say, no?  At any rate - yum!  What a find, on an otherwise dreary foggy day in the Outer Richmond....we loved loved loved the broiled grapefruit with the brulée topping, cherries and fruit.  Yes please, more please!   The Japanese breakfast was lovely, and my croque monsieur was a very different interpretation from the usual gooey-ham and cheese sandwich...a superb, albeit messy/drippy symphony of flavors and textures and I would like another one of those too, please. Wish I lived nearby!  Y'all get out there and give them some love, they deserve it!
author: Natalia B.

description: The Bourbon Vanilla Honey Mocha was fantastic! Not overpowering sweetness, great coffee flavor. Very friendly staff, cute shop.
author: Michael L.

description:
My visit was sometime time in April, I believe. I wanted to make a review when I got home, but I was so angry that I needed to give it a little time and space to reflect on what happened before posting. 

In a nutshell, my husband and I were chastised by server because she thought my husband and I took too many napkins (honest mistake, hubby grabbed some on his way back from the restroom not knowing that I already had grabbed some...honestly, we are not wasteful people). In lieu of greeting us, the server stood at our table and stared really hard at the stack of napkins, and then at us,  then offered to take some napkins back (was she going to reuse them?). Hubby and I just stared at her incredulously. Huh? She was obviously seething. At the conclusion of my meal (food was decent), to make a point to the manager about the napkin debacle, I made my way to the cashier to return the unused napkins. I was intercepted by the seething server as I approached the cashier, only to find out the she is the OWNER of the restaurant. I told her I didn't appreciate how rude and accusatory she was over such a small thing, and I suggested that if cost was an issue, that she may want to keep napkins behind the counter. Her reaction was UNBELIEVABLE. She heard nothing that I said, and continued to yell at me. She is an  outwardly extremely hostile individual who should not be working with the public. It was really crazy, I've NEVER encountered anything such as this before.

Please don't spend your money here and encourage this type of service/behavior. This woman needs to understand how to treat CUSTOMERS.
author: Gingersnappy T.

description: Cute little brunch spot! The owner obviously put a lot of effort into making her customers comfortable with the littlw detail (beautiful fresh flowers, lovely tableware, delicious food). I like that they offer breakfast options thata not typically sold in brunch places.
author: Sarah L.

description: Delicious lattes! Wasn't too thrilled with the Japanese breakfast though. The croque madame was delish!
author: Kat C.

description: Nice restaurant, but the drinks are a little bit overpriced, based on the size. The terrace is really nice on a hot day.
author: Vincent V.

description: The staff here is super friendly and happy.  Great service, cozy ambiance and two thumbs up for serving Japanese breakfast with an onsen egg on the side.
author: Clara H.

description: The decor was not my favorite but who cares. The shrimp & avocado sliders  were delicious and the macaroons were melt-in-your-mouth addicting. My personal fav was the pistachio. Enjoy!
author: Brian R.

description:
I came for dinner with a friend since she mentioned the breakfast/brunch was good. As per yelp reviews, I ordered the curry meatballs. We also shared a bbq rib appetizer.

I thought the bbq ribs were pretty good. Meat fell off the bones, flavor was a little above average, but nothing to die for. We only got 4 pieces.

Curry Meatballs - Honestly, I would just call it Tomato Sauce Meatballs. I tasted no curry, and it felt like the same kind of tomato sauce you'd find in pasta.

Friend ordered the Pork Belly which I thought was ok, but a bit plain.

I would definitely stop by again to try the breakfast/brunch.
author: Mary L.

description: This place if quite good, I only tried their iced-t but it was real good. Really, nice decor and friendly stuff. It seems these people really try and really think about how to over interesting drinks and food. One problem is that this place has some strange working hours, can't they stay open the whole day?
author: El J.

description:
I had been reading about this place for a while but haven't had time to go because of conflicting work schedules. So luckily, since I was off, I got to choose this place for my birthday breakfast. :D

Upon first entering I immediately fell in love with the place. The decor from the wood floors to the chalk wall were so charming that I could tell the owners took care into making sure every detail of their restaurant was exactly how they wanted it. The woman who I'm sure is the owner took the bf and my order was very friendly. We had no trouble ordering since the menu was simple although everything looked tasty. Knowing that they were brewing Ritual coffee, I quickly ordered a latte with the scrambled eggs + toast + jam + bacon breakfast. 

Seating was nice in that it was friendly for both couples and groups and there was even option of outdoor seating. There was hardly a wait for both receiving the drinks and the food. All the staff who had helped us were extremely friendly. The latte I had was perfect, I feel like anyone who doesn't order whole milk for their latte is missing out. The Bf and I had ended up ordering the same meal which was great, because I really didn't feel like sharing. The bacon was UHmazing, think of the perfect holiday ham that's sliced on Christmas type of good. The toast was perfectly seasoned with pepper and butter. The salad nicely dressed and ended up paring really well with everything. The homemade strawberry jam was definitely not to be missed. But the eggs, OH mylanta the eggs, I am a bit of a scrambled eggs connoisseur so once I noticed that they were not only perfectly cooked so that each bite was moist and fluffy, but was ALSO seasoned with fresh black peppercorn... we'll just say my mouth was in breakfast heaven. 

I will definitely return!
author: Darline D.

description: A unique and different brunch spot with cute decorations. The spiced honey latte and bourbon vanilla latte are delicious and sweet. A must get is the 72hr burger and the chorizo hash bowl.  To finish off with macaroons is a great treat! Pricing is fair and the ambiance is cute. Will return to try their lunch and dinner in the future.
author: Jennie W.

description: I came here for a surprise date night and definitely worth it. The owner Yuka, who was also our waiter was super nice and friendly and actually wanted to talk to us and get to know us and our names. They take online reservations through yelp  for dinners and brunch which is always a plus. The menu wasn't super impressive but when we ordered and ate the food; mind blown. We ordered the lamb chops and one of their daily specials which was the scallop risotto.  Everything was made to perfection. It was very homey and simple. The restaurant is small so it definitely added to the ambience. We also ordered drinks and dessert. I highly recommend the bread pudding!  After getting appetizers, drinks, and entrees it was all very affordable. Yuka even gave us some macaroons to take home. We definitely love Yuka and everything about Casava. It's definitely worth the drive into outer richmond just to try Casava!
author: Alister L.

description: Met a friend for lunch here on a Friday. Interesting menu, good presentation, adorable place. I will be back!
author: christine c.

description:
this is the cutest little bakery known to me. it's tiny and bright. they've got terarriums hanging around adding even more charm. their little names/signs for sugar, honey, and other things are adorable but i'll let you go and see for yourself. the chocolate croissant was just right and the little cute woman at the counter offered to heat it up and melt the chocolate. she must know that that makes me smile inside. and it doesn't hurt that she told me my eyes were a nice shade of different. 

oh, and they do pop-up dinners for $45 which i hope to one day partake in.
author: Regina C.

description: Stopped in for Sunday brunch, had the traditional Japanese breakfast and the veggie panini, everything was incredible from service to food quality.  Also had the macaroons from Patisserie Philippe, which are probably the best that I had in the Bay Area!
author: Mandy C.

description: I've come here for lunch a couple times.  Usually get the curry meatballs which is ok but generally kind of bland,  it's more like tomato sauce and meatballs. Staff are ok but owner is not particularly friendly.  Most likely will not be going back.
author: Piers Y.

description: I stopped in here because I was craving a cup of coffee while exploring the Outer Richmond.  I'll leave it at it's not the best place for a casual cup of coffee like I was looking for, but that doesn't mean this is a bad place by any means.  Service and staff were both great, the macchiato I got was delicious, and the place itself is nice.  Plus there is outdoor seating, which can be nice on Balboa St.  My only complaint is that I didn't see anything identifying it as Cassava until I walked in.  I'm sure I'll come back here, and I recommend checking it out if you're in the area!
author: Eric L.

description: great service and breakfast. the coffee was a bit bitter for my taste buds, but overall great local cafe
author: Vivian H.

description: Everyone who works here is friendly, kind and goes out of their way to make everyone happy and comfortable. We go for the coffee but are excited to try one of the dinner nights. A friend of ours works for Ritual Coffee and says that everyone there is a pleasure to do business with, they're one of her favorite clients. So please make sure you go here and keep the business flourishing!
author: Lyssa I.

description: Balboa has always been a strictly neighborhoody-place, but Cassava has uplifted the quaint neighborhood into a weekend destination. Interesting sweet latte concoctions, homestyle Japanese dishes served tastefully. Not sure if I'll ever crave something from here, but I'll come here again if I'm in the area.
author: John D.

description: Over priced and uneven quality. The chicken entre was tough. The smoked trout was good. The yelp reviews made me expect better. The dinner for 2 @ $130 wasn't worth it to me.
author: Martha N.

description: Slow. Hardly anyone here and 45 min and nothing in sight for an order of eggs and toast.
author: Md M.

description: Came here for one of the pop up dinners. AMAZING. Its a 5-6 course meal, and every single item is perfection.My favorites were the split pea soup and the gnocci. It's really hard to get reservations - they fill up months in advance. I'd recommend following them on Facebook or giving them a call a week or so before a dinner date to see if they have any last minute cancellations. Definitely a must do.
author: Lauren D.

description: I had to wait awhile for my quiche on a Sunday. Relaxed at table with rare Richmond sun streaming. Just had first bite. Yum! Absolutely worth the wait. Delicious!
author: Deborah L.

description: The four of us found ourselves without dinner plans at 6:30pm on a Friday night. I telephoned immediately and was able to get a table for 8:30pm. The place was smokey smelled like the BBQ when we got there. It was nice except the odor would stick on one's clothes for couple days. The pan seared scallops and the roasted chicken were delicious but the pork was fatty and under-seasoned. All the desserts were fantastic. The chocolate mousse and vanilla panna cotta were heavenly; creme brulee was solid also. Altogether a great experience for a last minute Friday night choice.
author: Sean W.

description:
what a nice place!

definitely worth the schlep in the rain, and that is saying a lot, because today's schlep in the rain included the following miserable mishaps (1) getting drenched falling down into a puddle, (2) braising my knee, feeling incredibly embarrassed and even (3) crying a little, (4) breaking my umbrella in two parts, and (5) not getting half my work done, despite a very strict deadline.

anyway, I hope for your sake that when you finally make it up here (which I recommend happens today or tomorrow at the latest) you won't have to go through half my trouble, before being rewarded with the

* Incredible personability of owners
* spectacularly made ritual espresso (they have definitely learned and mastered the craft of making it)
* warmth and pleasentness of the actual place
* quiche, which all the other patrons where impressed by, sandwich, or an incredible looking homemade brownie. 
* i'm waiting that they start using their preserves in the sandwiches: they are so handsome looking!

*** just as an aside: To prove how impressed i am with this place, this review is contributed after a very long yelping drought, which i decided on on principle, being annoyed with the venue to which i am finding myself once again contributing. since i am not longer a person of principle, I may just as well continue reviewing.
author: tal n.

description: Excellent food and friendly, helpful service.  I had a vegetarian panini and a delicious hibiscus spritzer.  It filled me up and I enjoyed every bite. It is a small space but full of positive energy, delicious food and wonderful staff.
author: Ursula L.

description:
Cute cafes have let me down in the past with their promise of cozy deliciousness only to let me down with a swift kick of mediocre food and poor service. Not the case with Cassava Bakery + Cafe!! 

The atmosphere is simply lovely! Clean, modern and really inviting, I wish there was more seating so I could just camp out here all day! I've been about 4 times, but each time I go I find something else to love. I've tried their sandwiches (lovely and LARGE PORTIONS), and their quiche, which was one of the best quiches I've ever had (this counts when I went to France! Ok, disclaimer, I might not have went to the best places for quiche, but you get my drift) and it came with a excellent light salad. YUM.  The newest addition is the pop-up dinner. The price tag might seem high ($~50 with ice tea and hot tea) but with 7 courses perfectly sized and each crafted with a great amount of care, it was totally worth it! Next thing on my list is the Japanese breakfast (only served on the weekends). 

As many other reviews have pointed out the service is first rate. Whenever I go, I always feel welcomed and that my business is appreciated. Some reviews have pointed out that the prices are a tad higher than some places, but I'm willing to pay a little more for great food and great service, it deserves to be rewarded in my book! 

Run, don't walk, to Cassava to see for yourself! I'll probably see you there.
author: Meghan R.

description:
We've been going to Cassava regularly - at least once a week -- for the past almost year and a half since the day it opened. We love the food -- simple and delicious; drinks -- wonderful lattes, hot drinks, and now fresh juices; and its amazing customer service.  Kris and Yuka go out of their way to make sure that every guest has nice experience at their restaurant. It is a labor of love for them and they have worked tirelessly to make Cassava the amazing gem that it is today.

I've tried almost everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. My favorites include the Japanese breakfast, Kris' Meal Salad, the Randwich, and Grilled Cheese with turkey or ham (my kids' favorite). My husband loves the Truffle Chorizo Hash Bowl and the Meatballs. The soups and quiches are amazing and the Patisserie Phillipe Macarons (try the seasonal pumpkin ones too) are incredible. We've also eaten at Cassava's tasting dinners many many times and are always blown away by Kris' skills as a chef. In short, this place rocks. 

For those of us living in the neighborhood, it's become a community mecca. We've lived in the Outer Richmond for almost nine years and until Cassava opened, never really spent a lot of time on our main drag -- Balboa St. Now we're always there -- seeing our neighbors and meeting new friends. 

We are pretty down to earth people who love good food and Cassava has become one of our favorite places to eat in the city. Not only for the food, but the ambiance as well. It's modern and stylish, yet totally unpretentious and comfortable. We love it!
author: Emily L.

description: We recently moved to this neighborhood, a few blocks from Cassava, and tried this out for lunch.  We've been twice now for lunch on weekdays, and my husband and I agree it is delicious.  We also love the sangria with the strawberries, watermelon, and blueberries.  We were able to get a table, no problem, and the person at the counter was really friendly.  We are so glad we found this gem in our new neighborhood.
author: Debra A.

description:
i am blown away by yesterday's meal.
i hate to resort to cliches (& what looks like a copy of all the other reviews here),
but this place is an absolute gem.
the food was STELLAR, the service was exactly the right level of professionalism and caring, the setting was magic.

1. food - we had heirloom tomato salad, smoked trout (they do it themselves), albacore, scallops& guinea hen. every dish was perfectly executed& served HOT.   the chef has done an excellent job in thinking up flavorful combinations. the only discordant plate - potato chips w/ cheese& truffle oil.it's a small plate of kettle chips w/ shaved parm& that oil on top.  did they make the chips ?? if so, i'm impressed BUT it still seems alittle out of place - it has the feel of easy bar food.  having said that, they were inhaled in 30 seconds (& they're only $5).

2. service. yuka is a gifted hostess.  she makes everyone feel welcome, without being obtrusive.  she was also wearing a beautiful outfit - colorful shirt& tie (so looked very professional), with cool stick pin.

3. the location is outer balboa, so it 's the edge of sf.  there's greenery on the sidewalk, candles, sunflowers in short vases. it's informal & special.

i've had lesser meals at twice the price.  
foodie culture is easy to mock, but cassava is an example of the how that culture elevates dining at all levels. 
it wouldn't have been possible to get a meal of this quality decades ago at other than a TOP restaurant.
we're lucky to have it in a casual neighborhood place. 
cassava deserves every sf food accolade.
i hope they survive the onslaught of customers & interest.
author: Kim Y.

description:
Was really looking forward this place as I had passed by a few times and it was always crowded. Well here's my review in a nutshell:

-portions are too small. 17 bucks for 2 sandwiches and it feels like i ate an appetizer
-too much butter on panini bread and toasted too long (hard bread)
-nice service
-good atmosphere
-taste like they use good ingredients, including the sandwich meats

Overall, prolly would not go again for sandwiches.
author: Brian Y.

description: The staff here is super friendly and outgoing. They started up conversation with me and made me feel right at home. Loved the pastries as well.
author: Jason F.

description: This is my favorite brunch spot on the weekends.  If I didn't start work so early in the Financial District, I'd eat breakfast here every day.  The owners Yuka and Kris are so friendly and you can tell they put love and dedication to their craft in everything they make.  I love their honey vanilla bourbon mochas!  Just the right amount of sweetness with the bit of bourbon to make you feel like a man.  When I'm not in a rush, I always get their japanese breakfast.  It tastes oh so good and makes me feel content and ready to start my weekend relaxing.  When I am in a rush, I always get their Randwich or breakfast croissant sandwich.  Perfect for eating at the beach or while driving down to Santa Cruz.
author: Yvette T.

description: It was alright.  nothing super awesome, but no complaints either.  Quaint little hipster breakfast joint.
author: Hann A.

description: Can't wait to see the renovations! Bright and fresh this place is exactly what the richmond needs. The staff is always super nice and the honey late' is delicious. All the luck to you guys.
author: Darla M.

description:
My first time out to the outer Richmond post a Lands End Hike.  Went on Yelp and found this restaurant listed as "American", I was starving and wanted breakfast.  It was Sunday lunch/brunch, call it was you will.  I really don't think it is "American" at all, which is fine, but don't be mislead,  it has a lot of Japanese influences, so perhaps Asian Fusion would be more accurate.  I asked to sit outside, because I had my dog with me, and they said the empty table was reserved.  Fine, understandable and reasonable, so I sat inside.  Ordered the ribs and a glass of rose.  Honestly, the menu was a little odd, and not very "American" at all, so I wasn't sure what to order.  In hind sight, I think I should have ordered the Japanese breakfast. I was there for maybe 45 minutes to an hour, and they never sat said table outside.  When I left, they finally sat one guy (it was a three top, which I could understand why they would want to sit three people there instead of one and he didn't even have a dog!  Poor service.  
Regarding the ribs, they were very well cooked and falling off the bone, but I couldn't eat them.  It's probably a matter of personal preference, but there was an overwhelming spice that took over all flavors and I just didn't like them.  Cinnamon perhaps?
Place is cute and well appointed.  I think I mis-ordered, but the bad service regarding the table is inexcusable and hence will not be going back.  
I got home, still starving, and made a salad.
author: Anne S.

description: LOOOVE this place!  I love coming here when I can.  I haven't tried too many of their stuff, but when I do, it's fantastic.  I tried the scramble and toast is also excellent.  Nicely scrambled eggs, a side of toast with homemade jam, and lettuce & a slice of tomato if you want to make a sandwich.  The green tea and pastries are tasty, and service is great.  The owners/chef are super nice, and all the other waiters are very attentive to your needs/request.
author: Sara C.

description: Mâché latte was perfect. Atmosphere is great. A nice stop after the Legion of Honor museum.
author: Brian L.

description: Came here for a private dinner birthday party. They know how to cook, serve, and host. It was family style. Appetizer: Kris' Caesar Salad, Quinoa Salad, Egg & Tomato Salad. Main Course: Porchetta & Figs, 72hr Braised Short Ribs in Pot, Truffle Oil Tossed Potatoes & Bacon, Kale Summer Corn & Mushroom. Desert: Chocolate Pot de Creme. It was the best dinner party I've been too. No complaints at all. Only positive everything. Can't wait to try their stuff during the day.
author: Joseph B.

description: The best scallops I have ever had! I love this restaurant/Cafe. The ambience reminds me of Flour bakery in Boston. The menu is a bit limited, but it is delicious, cozy, clean, welcoming. Highly recommend it!
author: Natalie W.

description: After reading the rave reviews and seeing this place on Scoutmob, I decided to give it a try. Though the couple are quite nice and you can tell they put their all into the baked and savory goods, I just was not impressed. I got the peanut butter cookie and curry pastry, which were both forgetful and mediocre at best.
author: Surge C.

description: I love their macaroons and what not.  Yes, the little dishes are a little pricey, but it's absolutely tasty and the service is great here.  The staff is very friendly and easy to talk to.  I am a bit picky with bakeries, but the staff is always good with suggesting what to try on the menu and the baked goods are tasty.  TRY THE MACAROONS.  So tasty!!  It's right up the street so I try to go as often as I can when I have time from school and work!
author: John H.

description: I love everything about this place. The decor is charming. The staff is extremely friendly. The food is delicious. If you check in on yelp you get a free curry puff and a cookie. The puff was flaky and filled with curry goodness. The ham and cheese sandwich was so flavorful and satisfying. It came with a simple romaine salad with sliced kumquats. Places like this make your day.
author: Sophia C.

description: Ordered a coffee and croissant and asked for jam, "please".  A mini dollop of jam for a dollar!  Holy marmalade!  You guys need to cheapen-up.
author: Nils R.

description:
We went here for brunch this morning- our first time since the remodel. They definitely needed more space and it looked pretty good! The food here is fresh and innovative and they use quality ingredients. My boyfriend got the chorizo hash bowl which came with a side of rice. It was good, but the portion was small. His mom got the croque monsieur breakfast sandwich. That was great, the cheese was a standout. I got the Japanese breakfast. For the most part, it is delicious but the miso is very bland and I ordered the tuna as an extra, but one piece of the two small pieces they served was pure bone and therefore inedible. 

The one thing that really disappointed me was when we were paying. We originally ordered a breakfast croissant (7$), and then the server (who spoke so softly we could barely carry on a conversation with her) asked if we wanted to try the croque monsieur instead (12$). Well, no, we didn't, but then she said sorry but they are out of the crossiant. So we said sure replace it with the other sandwich, and without even saying anything about how it will cost almost twice as much- rang it up! If you are wondering what the difference is between these two sandwiches- it is that the croque monsieur has turkey on it.  If that isn't a bait and switch.....I don't know what is. Lastly, I don't drink coffee but my dining mates did and they don't do refills. Honestly, we spent 50$ on breakfast for three people, and not offering coffee refills is pretty stingy. So, I will probably be back for dinner since the food is good, but these few negatives result in Cassava most likely not being my regular go-to breakfast/lunch/whenever spot.

In the end- portions are tiny and it is expensive, even by San Francisco standards. The service is not personable enough to justify these downfalls.
author: Natalie V.

description:
Loved the latte!! So many places try so hard to provide great coffee, this place isn't even trying.Just wish the cafe had more tables, it got really crowded this weekend.  Definitely will go back, we don't need to go to HAYES for great coffee.
I think its cheaper too!!! Quiche and sandwich were good, but I'm addicted to that coffee.
author: mama s.

description:
This review is fully based on the service - which is non-existent.  Shame on the owners (who worked at such esteemed restaurants as Luce) to allow such amateurs to run this shop.  First off, the tables are far too cramped together and this may fly in the Mission, but out here in the Richmond, this does not constitute as cozy -- it's just downright ridiculous.  Why don't you also hire a cashier girl who remembers that she had told your patron that the drip coffee will be ready in 10 minutes, only to go up to the the same person again (to the baby faced Asian girl who wears her hair in Pippi Longstocking braids -- your customer service sucks!!)  and either she has early on-set Alzheimers or she just does not give a shit (I'm pretty sure its the latter), to be told - "oh, you wanted what again?" (snarky attitude included free of charge).  I know your busy because its a Sunday brunch but seriously, get your orders right.  

Trust me, the ONLY reason why this place stays open because they currently have no competition.  Otherwise, the way this place is run -- they're doing a GREAT job of alienating the local population. This local is on top of the list.
author: Hannah H.

description: Nice place , friendly service, affordable good food in the neighborhood
author: T S.

description: I ordered Quiche and cookies.The taste of quiche is fine,but the portion is too small.After I ate it,I was still hungry.I felt I just ate an appetizer.If I think about the potion,those are overpriced,I will stay away this place and go to Simple Pleasures Cafe to eat big yummy Quiche.
author: Hiro R.

description: I had their scramble breakfast. I was so delicious. There is a fine line between great and bad scramble eggs. They cooked it to perfection. It was soft, fluffy and wonderfully seasoned. The grilled toast was even salted and balanced out whatever you put on it. It enhances the jammy flavor when I spread their yummy jam on it. Also my favorite there is their spicy honey latte.
author: Loun P.

description: Pleasant little place! Clean, bright, airy space with really friendly and attentive service. Used the Scoutmob deal to get a free curry puff and peanut butter cookie bite, which were both excellent - I was really tempted to go back for a second curry puff, they were so good, and the cookie was not too sweet or cloyingly peanut buttery. A perfect snack. I also ordered a bourbon vanilla honey mocha, which was unusual and delicious. Would love to go back to try more menu items. The place is small (3-4 tables) and not the kind of cafe I'd be inclined to settle into for an entire afternoon to read or do work (even though they apparently have free wifi), but definitely a place I would come for lunch or coffee with friends. Well done, Cassava!
author: Caitlin H.

description: I loved the croissantwich with egg and black forest ham.  It was a delish brunch.  The macarons were a treat, but a bit pricey.
author: Priscilla K.

description: Absolutely hands down quite the GEM of the neighborhood!! Been there a handful of times for weekend brunch and was absolutely pleasantly surprised and blown away by the simplicity and decadence of their menu. My favorite brunch item is hands down the short rib sliders--soooo yummy!!! The coffee/cappuccino is superb, not to mention the hibiscus cooler which is simply heavenly.
author: Ahna K.

description:
Updating my former review to give 5 stars after going here on more occasions.  I've tried a lot more of their menu and their drinks are fantastic!  I particularly love their honey latte. The veggie panini and shrimp sliders are my favorite food item.  

Also, they've recently expanded with much more room to sit and enjoy your meal.  The decor is so quaint and it has an excellent ambiance.  The staff is friendly and helpful too.
author: J. Marie N.

description: Solid lunch items. I'd highly recommend the curry with fatty pork & rice and the pressed turkey melt with tomato jam. Definitely would come back to eat again.
author: Dave H.

description: I think that this place is best known for breakfast and lunch but I went for dinner.  If you happen to be in the outer richmond with some friends at dinner time, I would highly recommend this one.  For four, we shared two of the vegetables (lentils and brussel sprouts), all three starters and two main courses.  That was about perfect.  The service was friendly and attentive, food combined inventive and familiar as everything was delicious. Don't miss the brussel sprouts or ribs.
author: kurt d.

description: I absolutely adore Cassava! I've been there for breakfast, lunch, dinner and brunch! They just keep getting better and better. Their food is farms to table style and it really shows with their fresh ingredients. Each plate is so innovative and creative! Their brunch is so unique and delicious! They have amazing sangria and their beer/wine list is great! The owner, servers, chefs are very attentive and so sweet.
author: Trang N.

description: Stumbled here after failed attempts at Plow and Outerlands the woman suggested this place, which is very small and intimate, was a perfect choice for our early Sunday morning breakfast .... we both had the Jap breakfast which was a perfect portion .. the coffee and teas are great here as well .. i had a spiced vanilla latte which was very delightful ... employees were all smiles and very helpful ... I want to come  back the next chance I get to have another good experience and maybe try a sandwich ... :)
author: Anthony S.

description:
such a wonderful new addition to the neighborhood! this cafe is all charm and whimsy. the staff take their time to talk to you and explain each of their goodies on display. i had the quiche (mushroom and kale) and the curry puff (filled with curried potato and beef, if memory serves me correctly).

the quiche was amazing. i didn't expect deliciousness to be that delicious. juicy slices of mushroom, earthy kale, in all that creaminess....moar moar moar!

the curry puff could've had more filling inside; i was a sad panda when i realized that curried goodness is only right in the center of the puff. the puff pastry itself was wonderfully flaky and buttery. curry flavor could perhaps be turned up a notch or two? but then again, i'm malaysian and chug chilli sauce with my PB&J sammich in the AMs.

thank you for the great attentiveness from the staff; my table was cleared real quick and i got clean plates to replace used ones after ordering more pastries from their artist baker of the day (butter love bakeshop!! in another review). another thank you to staff member Cruz (if i'm not mistaken. i'm  talking about the guy with the boss, almost ron swanson 'stache) who let me throw an easter egg candy into his mouth after being dared by my unclassy eating companions. 

will definitely come back for their savory sammiches. they sound and smell divine! it's a very small place with three small tables fitting 2 people per table, so keep that in mind if you plan to eat in here with your 4 children in tow.

visit, drink tea, nibble on carbs, feel quaint!
author: Eliza D.

description: Went here for Lunch around 1 pm on a Sunday and the restaurant was full, so we had to wait for around 15 minutes. The menu only has a few offerings, so I felt a bit limited by the selection. Once we ordered, it took almost an hour for our food to arrive. Their kitchen seemed pretty small, so it probably it always slow whenever they are crowded. Overall, the food was good but nothing amazing.
author: Scoot S.

description: First impression from the outside, nice. Second impression going in, not too pleased with service. People dressed up way too fancy for a coffee shop and no greeting whatsoever. Ordered a regular latte and...it was decent, not strong enough.  Le Bread, the place they took over was better and cheaper... May consider coming back to try their regular coffee to test it out.
author: Amy T.

description: The coffee is fantastic, people are personable and friendly & they gladly made lettuce wraps for us in lieu of sandwiches when we told them we don't eat bread. The wraps were wonderfully flavorful & delicious!
author: Sarah D.

description: Very happy to see this place opening in the neighborhood, so I stopped by with a friend and our kids today for lunch. It's a tiny interior, probably not the best place to linger or squeeze in a stroller but it's cute, and they seem to be planning to have some outdoor tables, which would be nice. Service was cheerful and friendly (as you'd hope, on opening day!), food was both tasty and well presented.
