(We had cauliflower soup, curry puffs, peanut-butter cornflake cookies for the boys) I'm particularly impressed by the prices, which seem almost bizarrely reasonable by San Francisco standards. We'll be back-- I'm looking forward to trying the sandwiches and other items.
author: Sara G.

description: Cute little place on Balboa near the movie theatre. Had the "Cold Turkey Sandwich" which was great. Nice green and smoked gouda accompany the flavorful turkey on semifreddi's baguette. Served with a small green salad of romain, cucumbers and other tender greens. Small but well priced considering the care put into the flavors an presentation. Yum yum!
author: Arthur G.

description: My friend and I had dinner of ramen noodles at a Japanese restaurant on Clement and were craving for dessert. We chanced on Cassava. The hostess as well as all the servers were all friendly and professional and all had pretty smiles on their faces. We tried one of their dessert wine, their hot mocha with honey, and their panna cota. In total, it was a brief but great experience. We will sure be back and have dinner there and desserts !
author: Maite d.

description: This is the second time I have gone to the restraunt in the morning after 800 am like 900am and it has not been opened. I actually walked by one evening and I was told it opens at 800am as indicated on the website. If you are not going to open on time signs should be posted.simply pleasures seems to be dependable and has good food. Maybe one day it will be open on time during the weekend.
author: Frances L.

description: Cassava is an amazing establishment. I took my wife there this past Friday for her special birthday dinner. I made the reservation through Yelp and everything was very smooth from beginning to end. The moment we walked in, we were greeted by the hostess and they seat us right away. After we sat down, 2 glasses of French sparkling wine was brought to us without me asking. They knew that we were celebrating a special occasion. The service was amazing. Yuka was very kind and attentive while Kris, her husband, was busy working his magic in the kitchen. We started out with the lettuce & Dungeness crab salad and the smoked trout which I understand they smoked themselves. For the main course, I had the roasted Pintade while my wife had the lamb loin. For dessert, Yuka recommended her favorite the Vanilla Panna Cotta and it was absolutely amazing!  Everything we had was excellent, but what I love most about this place is the quaintness and the owner's attention to details from the food to the service to the decor.  This may be a small place but they have a big heart. Thanks to Yuka & Kris and their staff for making this a great experience for us.  Dinner was a success!  We will definitely stop by on other occasions!
author: Chet T.

description: The first time I came here for brunch, it was great.  The food was great and service was great.  The second time I came for brunch, I already had something small to eat earlier and didn't want a full meal.  I know on their menu they don't offer pastries or side dishes for brunch.  They do offer desserts but I wasn't feeling like getting something sweet for brunch.  I asked who I believe was the owner if they had anything small like pastries.  She mentioned they don't have any side dishes or small pastries but can make one waffle with some fruit on it for me.  I said great!  I thought I was pretty clear on wanting waffle with fruit on the top but the owner kept pushing me to get the full waffle meal with scrambled eggs.  I told her I wanted the single waffle as I already had something small to eat earlier and I wasn't extremely hungry.  I don't know what happened, but somewhere in our communication she didn't get that I didn't want a full complete meal!  After I insisted on getting the single waffle, I noticed her demeanor and body language changed.  She made this subtle unpleasant facial expression to indicate she thought it was weird I just wanted something small to eat and walked away. I literally had something to eat earlier and I had room in my tummy for a waffle but not a full meal!  It just left me feeling uneasy when all she had to do was say no problem!  If you want a single waffle with a few pieces of fruit on the top for $7, no problem!  We ill get it for you.  I'm not sure why that was so hard to do.  I think I'm going to stay away from Cassava for a little while.
author: Chloe A.

description: Cute bakery with a kitchey-stylish interior that would make Martha Stewart proud. I ordered a dozen of their signature peanut butter cornflake cookies and brownies for a party. The peanut butter cornflake cookie has a delicate, crumbly texture and isn't too sweet. Unfortunately, the brownies lacked cocoa flavors and were disappointingly dry. The staff were helpful and super nice. A refreshing addition to Outer Richmond.
author: Anne D.

description: I have lived in this neighborhood for five years, and Cassava is the best thing that has ever happened to it.  Kris and Yuka are wonderful owners who know how to make customers feel welcome and cared-for.  Food-wise, the brunch fare is fresh and delicious, perfect for a nice bite in the morning.  I love the chorizo hash bowl, the randwich, the curry meatballs, the japanese breakfast, and of course, the signature curry puffs.  The coffee is the best in all the Richmond.  My boyfriend and I also adored the intimate weekend dinners with seasonal menus.  Kris is a fantastic chef, and his skill seems to continuously grow.  I cannot wait for this place to re-open after renovation and experience it as a full blown restaurant.
author: Victoria R.

description: Fiddlehead ferns--who knew that they were delicious when pickled? Cassava's inventive dishes included the ferns with the lamb dish--meat cooked perfectly, and garnished beautifully. The quinoa salad was a treat--well balanced, with subtle flavors and a texture that was a bit crunchy. The Brussels Sprouts retained the crispness and flavor that make for a memorable dish. The service was attentive, yet not intrusive.  Since the menu changes [see their webpage,] Cassava uses in-season and the freshest of ingredients. After a second visit for dinner, I consider this restaurant a wonderful addition to the neighborhood. Can't wait to try all the other choices!
author: Buffy F.

description: A nice addition to the Outer Richmond Balboa corridor. Tasty breakfast croissant.  No decaf coffee and poor service gets three stars. Breakfast options are not traditional American breakfast options and that is cool. Meat balls in curry with fried egg sounds interesting. Not sure I will go back to try it as breakfast is very much my meal but the Japanese breakfast will probably bring me back as I miss Tokyo. Neighbors dining there are friendly. Great out door options for the February drought weather we are "enjoying". Cheers.
author: Why N.

description: I've tried this place a couple of times and each time haven't been that impressed. The coffee was just ok. There may be one or two pastry items, usually some kind of cookie or croissant that didn't look that appetizing. I did try one of their sandwiches, a vegan one that was also just ok but cost like $8. Most items on their typically tiny menu are frightfully expensive. It's a very tiny space with an always changing menu. If you go, expect to shell out some bucks. I'm going to save my money and go somewhere esle.
author: Jag F.

description:
These guys know their food and coffee!!  Went here because Miki wasn't opened yet and I noticed it was a new spot (had no idea Le Bread closed down) and I'm glad I made the decision.  

I had the meatballs with curry sauce... and it was probably the juiciest meatballs I've ever had.  It was served with some tofu on top, and I think I saw the chef torch the top to give it a nice crust.  Overall, I just couldn't believe how good it was.

I also had a shot of espresso.  Perfect.  It's good to know they serve Ritual... that way I don't have to go all the way to the Mission just go get a good shot of espresso.  Great place to go in the area if you need a caffeine fix... you can also avoid the asian persuasion onslaught that is Purple Kow (I like their milk tea though lol).
author: Randy T.

description: A small ambient nice, mom & pop or "hole" in the wall joint which makes SF unique eating out. We had the crab salad, polenta & chicken which all were tasty. Price ok but some may disagree. However service w/a smile..: ) which service was outstanding & that's big deal. Hoping to try breakfast next time. Kool area w/surrounding other choices & Cliff House is NW..
author: Francisco M.

description: Such a pretty place, I only hope they get the tables back in front! Very nice and tasty food. A very special menu and its great the care they take in sourcing & knowing what is good/healthy/fresh. Welcome to the neighborhood! So glad you arrived!
author: Jelly B.

description:
Singularly impressive; smooth, elegant tiny bakery and cafe.  
It was the opening day - but rare an opening hitch - and any slight hitch recovered with a sophisticated and understated manner.  

The food was from Chef Kris' extensive and mature recipes.  I tried the wonderful ham and cheese sandwich on rye bread (warmed) - an intriguing combination of spices that yearned for a lovely Bordeaux! 

The deserts, (not of the proprietors baking) looked excellent and largely gone by the time lunch arrived.  Yuka's specialty coffee more than made up for its absence. 
I know that this Cafe will be a long term winner for two reasons.  Unlike others I have reviewed - the recipes are original and authentic reflecting the not inconsiderable skill of the Chef Kris.  The service provided by Yuka and her team will always be authentic and authentically directed at their customers. 

I wish them the very best and plan to be a regular customer.
author: Harold C.

description: Very nice food. Japanese fusion menu. Japanese breakfast was light and refreshing. The short rib sandwich and the fried egg sandwich was amazing. Baked goods seem to run out very fast so did not get to sample.
author: Mike C.

description: Yummy!!! Neighborhood gem. Maybe a little too much aioli across dishes. Really great service. Impressed and will be back. Place has good feel.
author: jennifer j.

description: Finally - a delightful spot in the Outer Richmond with fabulous food and awesome service. We used to frequent another coffee shop in the neighborhood with a too-cool-for-school attitude (you know the one), but Cassava won us over. Yuka, Kris and the whole team are warm and friendly. The Japanese Breakfast is super satisfying on a foggy day and Kris adds new little flourishes to each dish depending upon what is in season. Yes, it's true that there's often a wait on weekends - but the atmosphere is clean and bright with tantalizing aromas and welcoming faces, so I don't mind lining up here!
author: DeForest R.

description: Cute place, yummy coffee, food catered to my picky needs, & personable staff (Kris/Yuka). Only issue is they need to open a place like this in Bernal :)
author: Fancy P.

description: Yummy food, great atmosphere.  We need more places like this in the Richmond District!  I only gave 4 stars because they are kinda slow, and they don't apologize for it.  Maybe that was a bad day for them: I asked once about my sandwich, then went up again to ask about something different  ... but was pre-empted by an unsmiling owner saying again that my order will be ready in a minute.  She wasn't rude, but seemed annoyed.  Take it down a notch,  I was just going to ask for a water!  But seriously I will come here again because the food is so good.
author: Mika D.

description: a great spot in a neighborhood that needs more food and drinking spot options. newly added 'wine cafe' menu for weeknights is perfect for ending a long work days. The weekend dinner's are a great date night event or with friends. always changing menu is great for locals.
author: n s.

description: Definitely cute neighborhood cafe. Enjoyed the quiche and some baked goods on a recent weekday morning. Staff pays a lot of attention to detail.
author: Brian C.

description: What a treat to have this cafe in our "hood!" Ritual Roasters beans and excellent quality food that is deliciously prepared. I've enjoyed egg dishes there and recently tried them for lunch. It seems like you can count on yummy goodness no matter what meal. I haven't had the whole menu, but the shrimp sliders are very tasty!
author: Heather D.

description: Cassava is a really nice coffee shop & bakery, though the baked goods are from semi-freddi.  They serve ritual coffee and the service is really nice.  They also offer light lunch options such as quiche, sandwiches, soup and a tasty curry beef puff.  This place is also clean and bright.  Yes, it's clean unlike the bakery 2 blocks down the street.
author: Flog G.

description: cassava's curry puff ... won my luff. sure enuff!
author: Caitlin C.

description: Fabulous ambiance, great coffee and outstanding service. Plus, it's run by an adorable couple.
author: Ginnie H.

description: came here for a private dinner party over the weekend. great food and great service.
author: danny n.

description: Holy crap. The spiced honey latte is delicious. The people who work here are ridiculously nice and I would come back in a heartbeat.  The place is tiny, but it's a nice place to hide out.
author: k h.

description: What a much needed classy place in the Outer Richmond District! Extremely nice staff. Very clean and charming decor. The macchiato I had was done perfectly. Looks like all of the baked goods are from Semifredo and the savory dishes are handmade in house. I think I would go for the savory dishes. The prices for a nice cafe are great! Only minus is that there is no plugs against main back wall for computers (they may have intended this so that people don't camp out too long). Either way I will be back for sure!
author: Joanna W.

description:
This place is really the place to go if you like a variety  of breakfast items,  their scrambled eggs and toast with a special preserve, addicting breakfast buns, dynamite curry puffs, yogurt parfaits with fresh fruits, very nice quiches, and some fantastic grilled sandwiches!  The newlyweds, Kris & Yuka, and their staff work really hard to make the place a comfy place for people to hang out at.  Plus, they have special dinners twice a month approximately, and we cannot give enough praise to their attention to service, detail, not to mention the fantastic food!  Their short ribs flake open just using your fork (no knife necessary - I mean it for real), and their dark chocolate truffles are unparalleled (My word of advice is do not share your chocolates.  Eat it all yourself and try to convince others to give you their share)!  I really believe that this couple makes Cassava Bakery & Cafe a happening place!  Plus, outdoor seating will be available very shortly.  Yeah! Just in time for the summer.  The ambiance is very nice as well.  Kris & Yuka have made this a very special hangout  for all  to enjoy!

Jan & George Perrenod
author: Jan P.

description: great coffee.   Super nice owners.   Home made baked goods are delicious
author: Charley R.

description: This place has become a regular spot for a weekend brunch for my wife and I.  We live around the corner and were happy to see Cassava open up not too long ago to provide a nicer, fresher, tastier food option in the neighborhood.  Everything you will try in Cassava tastes wonderful, although portions are not huge, so order an extra side if you are hungry.  The owners - Kris and Yuka - as well as the wait staff, are super-nice and friendly.  The atmosphere and the decor in this place are nice, welcoming, and warm - makes you want to hang out for a while.  Also try their Friday pop-up dinners (you have to reserve a spot ahead of time for those - menu changes every time).  Finally, they can do private parties which are great for groups of 10-14 people.  The place is small, so you take over the whole spot with your group, and it feels like you are having a meal in a private room of a high-end restaurant.
author: D K.

description: I rarely write reviews, but I just can't help it this time. Yesterday night, I had my first meal at Cassava. My husband and I had the pleasure of dining at Cassava's 2nd pop-up dinner. We were warmly welcomed by the owners, Yuka and Chis. The decor of Cassava was definitely intimate and cozy. There were about 4-5 tables in a small space but everyone had enough privacy to have a good conversation, but we were glad we could eavesdrop on some of the regulars special requests (like the bourbon mocha - so yummy) so that we could copy cat. We had an excellent meal. Everything on the menu was thoughtful and prepared with such care. My husband and I savored every bite. The chef showed his culinary skills in every dish. Everything was cooked perfectly and presented so beautifully. My favorite dish was the short ribs! The dish as so flavorful and it was paired with savory bread pudding. To die for! Cassava is real gem and hopefully, we will get to try the next dinner they have. The reservations fill up fast for these pop-up dinners since the seating is only 12. Once Chris or Yuka makes the announcements, it's best to call them up ASAP.
author: Antoinette L.
